comment: Oh bud, this is REAL good. Sweet and a little touch of smoke and sea breeze.
Nose is honey and vanilla. Has strong fruit smell almost like a Sherry cask finish. Delicious taste. Strongly fruity but still a light dram. Lots of honey and vanilla

Very sweet and very spicy. Sweet boost comes first then spicy boost immidiately follows.

After finishing the whole bottle, I edit my review to add more points: for now it became my top favorite whisky. I really love that rum sweetness - much more than sherry sweetness!
I'm a complete amateur and am totally new to this ... but I think I tasted a sugary and sweet emphasis from the aging in Rum cask....looking forward to learning more about whiskey!
Failed to save my notes, and now I've forgotten what I had written. Guess I'll have to drink some more!
Didn't like as much as the 12. There's a certain harshness from the Rum casks. 🤷‍♀️
smooth, vanilla, oak and brown sugar rum notes.
Really tasty. The tropical notes from the rum come through but it’s still a scotch so you get some of the malty flavor. Excellent.

I haven’t had the other balvenie bottles to compare, but this is pretty good.  I personally am a bourbon fan, and I tend to lean on the sweater side of whiskey in general. Peat is not my forte, but for a single malt this is up there for me.  Smooth, with a bite on the front end and medium finish. If you’re trying to break into scotch, not the worst place to start.
It's alright, nothing really special. Slightly odd sweetish taste. Strongish – I used a few drops of water sometimes, not every time. Quite an easy drinker.

Very pleasant.  A little bit of smoke.  The rum influences are much more mellow and sophisticated than I expected or have experienced in Rum seasoned or Rum finished whiskeys.  This has a banana flavor with cream and tropical fruit- maybe a hint of papaya?  Not at all what I expected in a whiskey.  The malt is definitely there in the forefront, the tropical flavors are more scenery to the scotch, which is as it should be.  There is a hint of brown sugar, but it's not strong.  This is a rich, oily, creamy dram with a lot of unusual stuff going on, but it really works - the balance between the whiskey and the finish is near perfect!
All time favorite, big fan of dark rum, so this makes sense.  Sweet, caramel, molasses, smooth, dark rum comes through, but it’s definitely a scotch.
Initial taste is ok but finishes very harsh. Tried as a mixer and still no bueno
The nose is spoiled fruit (the good kind I suppose?). Traditional Scotch flavor with a much sweeter, fruitier profile. Mouthfeel is medium. 3.8.
It's okay. The Caribbean flavors do not help, in my opinion.
Rich and sweet with vanilla and coconut notes

Wow, what a smooth dram. Honey and sweet vanilla with a bit of peat on the nose with a incredibly smooth green apple and vanilla palate. There's a bit more spice in this compared to the 12 year. Feels almost like a lazy bourbon.
very similar to the 12 year.  enjoyable.  would buy again.
Not peaty so I like it.
just the right amount of honey/sweet notes.
very sweet, not as much depth as the typical Balvenie
Very sweet. Nice light spice notes on the tongue.

Medium yellow color. The rum clearly comes through in the aroma. Also some hints of vanilla and citrus. Taste is a bit oaky with some apple and pepper. A nice smooth finish where the smoke comes through a bit. Definitely a Scotch but a really interesting fusion with the rum. The touch of water really doesn’t bring out much, I actually preferred it neat.

Spicy & sweet -  with a sharpness to balance it.  Subtle flavory notes from the rum barrels. light bodied, crispy, scents of brown sugar and honey. light, fast finish.  easier drinking and less complex than expected. Still highly enjoyable.
Super sweet and syrupy. A lot of rum on the nose and fruity notes.
very mild and soft lasting. vanilla
sweet and fruity, light smoke, carmel

The nose is slightly astringent but has notes of tropical fruit, honey, straw, burnt sugar and a hint of vanilla. The palate is sugary with strong notes of rum, followed by peat, vanilla and a slight medicinal note. The finish is medium with a fading tropical sweetness combined with smoky notes of vanilla and molasses.
Really good. Can taste the rum.  The finish is good.

Thanks to my parents for buying me a bottle of this excellent Balvenie for my birthday. I had this years ago and enjoyed it. Tonight I am reminded how nice and sweet this is. It might be a little too sweet for some people but I really enjoy it. Not as super complex as others from Balvenie but a solid example of just a great Scotch. Can’t wait to have some more.
Butterscotch, light oak spice, sweet caramel sugar

Nose has red wine and oak.  First taste all oak with no sweetness.  Long finish with maybe some dark fruit coming through.  Tasted after eating bbq and may need to try again as didn’t get a lot of the sweet notes from reviews.

Nose - Malt, Creamy toffee, pineapple

Taste - Malt, tropical fruit, slight spiciness
Sweet, but not too sweet. I enjoyed this one!
A nice scotch. Honey and fruit notes on nose and taste.
Excellent.  Minerality.  Clean and tangy.  Muted fruit that complements rather than divides.  More of this please.
As a rum and bourbon fan I enjoyed this. It tastes like scotch but a little sweeter.
Nice nose.  Spice level is subtle.  Mouthfeel is not very oily.  Easier to drink. Not exactly adventurous.
Yum! I love the salty quality of this expression!
A lovely delightful dram full of caramel, tropical fruits, spices, chocolate, and creamy vanilla .
very tasty - the rum cask finish is evident and works well.

0-1.5: Disgusting. Worth only mixing or meeting the drain. 
2: Bad. Wouldn’t feel bad mixing
2.5: Sub-par. OK, but bland or somewhat flawed. 
3: Good. Decent stuff, but not a top re-buy
3.5: Very good. I’d love to keep a bottle around
4: Excellent. A go to for me that is worthy of celebrating - will never get old
4.5: Incredible
5:Perfect and an all time favorite""
An astonishing whisky with the rich, sweet taste of rum. It’s a pleasure to have once or twice a week!
Can clearly pick up the rum spice. Still it remains smooth.
exceptionally smooth. Mega spicy. Not crazy about Rum so this isn’t for me. If you like rum though, run to this scotch.
Overwhelming sweet/rum. Very rich and good as a dessert drink.
A pleasant, unassuming nose acts as a gentle introduction to a complex initial impression. Warm spices, and a lingering finish make for a thoroughly enjoyable dram.
extremely smooth neat, honey, no smoke, full,

Part 3 of my Scotch flight trilogy and definitely the one I am most excited to try. This one is currently on sale at my local Costco for $55 so this will be the pour that decides whether or not I pull the trigger on it! On to the tasting:
On the pallette boy is it super sweet. Toffee, caramel, mollasas that is somewhat offset by a pleasant and needed spice note! Mid pallette adds some fruit and brown sugar notes leading to a shortish finish with a nice spice note. 
Now, again it's a pleasant pour for sure but it's just too sweet. Even as a Bourbon drinker this has too much Rum cask influence and not enough spice to offset it. Even at $55 I think I would pass. At the $80 SRP it's a hard pass for me. If you are looking for a desert dram, this could do the job otherwise look elsewhere.

Nose: Vanilla, Cherry, Caramel, hint of spiced rum
Palate: Cream Vanilla, Tropical Fruit, Dried Spices
Finish: Dried Spice, Banana, Malt
A touch exotic but a really good Scotch.
Great scotch for those that enjoy bourbon; easy to drink; flavorful yet still unique as a scotch; barrel taste is not overwhelming.

Nose: honey, caramel cream, tropical fruits (pineapple, papaya, toasted coconut), peaches, malt, and a faint undercurrent of peat. 

Palate: cream and honey kissed apples, barrel spice, melon, malt, oak, a hint of peat funk, cracked peppercorns, and a drying leather finish. 

A simple and easy dram to drink. Not very complex just well executed in it’s simplicity.
I'm very much enjoying this whiskey. Very sweet. Exceeded expectations.
Tasted it neat. Decent flavor with hints of rum, but a little too astringent and not enough going on for me otherwise.

This is a scotch that will make you double take. Hey he nose is a little pedestrian at first and opens up to something pretty interesting. I get spice and toasted brown sugar. Unique. 

First taste is is sweet, friendly, and smooth. Then lots of exotic fruit.  Short finish.  Good whiskey.
Sweet nose, watery mouthfeel, zero burn
This is a whisky that I got as an engagement gift. So I am giving this an additional 0.25 points for the sentiment.

Nose: Richer than the 12 year, with some banana from the rum. Jammy, somewhat earthy, rich caramel and vanilla

Palate: oily, banana and rich tropical fruits, wood

Finish: long, a little dry, spicy cloves
Smooth, not too much burn, good casket taste scotch
Very clean, light finish, notes of vanilla and oak.
Sweet tart nose, full and fruity with a big spicy back.
Honey, subtle caramel and vanilla, and a hint of smoke. Very smooth and delicious, tasted neat.
quite a complex whiskey. it takes some time to identify most flavor notes and adding water simplifies this task. great whiskey overall
Lightly sweet and smokey single malt with a great mouthfeel.
Smooth and not too sweet from the rum casks.  Slight hint of peat.  Worth the buy.
Light, fruity aroma. Crisp burn with very quick diminish. Sweet and fruity but hard to discern anything specifically. Pretty uninteresting overall.
Difficult nose and palate - not much beyond immediate honey and caramel. Home
Solid, very little bite, smooth caramel honey
At nose very sweet and vanilla, at taste strong vanilla taste, sweet smooth and warm, long creamy finish

Complex malt start and Interesting rum like finish. The finish is heavier for a scotch. Its a sweetish coffee and toffee flavor thats almost chewy. Try opening, enjoying a quarter of the bottle, and letting the rest develop in the bottle for a month or so. Seems to taste better over time.

Worth purchasing at least once...
Smooth taste with a bit of flavor after

향 : 럼, 
맛 발베니의 달콤, 럼, 
피니쉬 : 짧고 스파이시
Light, floral, oak. Don’t actually get rum influence. Weak flavors trying hard to be complex
From what I remember, overwhelming sweet spice from the rum cask left me with heartburn.

Lots of rum character with molasses, brown sugar, and spices like cinnamon and nutmeg, but it doesn't completely dominate the 14 YR though as I still get some smoke, toasted cereal grain, and tropical fruits like banana and passion fruit. Very nice body and richness

a great introduction to scotch. a smooth easy drinker but you can definitely taste the peat. As someone who started off with port Charlotte (Charles?) peat monster this was a much more approachable scotch $14 @ Barfly Baltimore

Too sweet for my taste.
Slight Honey and vanilla overtones.
Light sweetness on the nose with caramel hints. A little bite at first but quickly disappears. If you like the double wood 12 yo, this is definitely worth a try.
nice rum cask finish, not overly complex. good sipper neat

香氣飽滿 果香濃郁 蔗糖甜味 香草

口感不甜適中

尾韻中

5 star gang. The nose is just the start on this one, that tasteful tobacco and pleasant fruit notes. Baked apple pie sitting on the window ledge, waiting for someone to walk by and sneak a bite- still on the nose. Taste- all those fruits come alive and the spices, oh my Ggg. That apple pie turns to apple custard, like a caterpillar going through metamorphosis. The finish comes to a proper resolution with all the fuckery that has taken place with the nose and taste. 
Final Vedict: 9.5/10, but that's just me on this one, speaking as subjectively as possible. Try a pour while you're out first before committing to the bottle. I did this a handful of times and was sold almost instantly.
Seems great, but a little harsh or spicy, but I think it is showing me that I’m not a stoch guy
Super smooth. Pleasant. Would definitely drink in the Caribbean
smooth, Woody taste finished with a fruity taste
Rum flavor is subtle and well-balanced....this is still very much a Scotch. Full bodied without much peatiness.

Nose:
Rich creamy milk chocolate
Grilled pineapple 
Imitation green apple
Bourbon cask influence 
Vanilla
Cherry pips
A little rose water 

Arrival:
Light golden syrup 
Bitter oak wood
Pepper
dry grass

Development:
Red pawpaw
Persimmon 
Muskovado


Finish:
Billowing spices like when you dry fry baking spice
Clean fresh woody
Fruity Ethiopian coffee brew
Little hint of milky breakfast tea
Nice light scotch with a spicy finish

Nose: sweet sugar sharp raisin 
Palate: brown sugar light wood
Finish: sweet sugar dry end

Nice solid whisky with rum flavour
So well done. A staple in my home bar.
Smooth and tasty, but lacking in complexity for me. I prefer the double wood from Balvenie.

Sweet and mellow. Vanilla, carmelized cacao, and a faint green/vegetal note?

Pleasant to drink. Unique, enjoyable.
My go to! Sweet and smooth. Never disappoints.
Smoooooth. Very subtle, nice fruity hints and a wonderful finish. Potentially one of the best I’ve had to date.
Easy drinker with a nice oily texture. The flavor is weaker than what I'm used to, but it is one of the smoothest whiskies I've had.

I tried this at a place down the street after work. Not always the most ideal tasting conditions, but for more experimental releases like the Balvenie Caribbean Cask, in hindsight it seems like a smart, low-risk choice. 

For starters, I like a lot of the Balvenie’s other offerings, but I could not get into this one. The nose was straightforward and cloyingly sweet. I was more unimpressed with the palate - lacking. Light, and so much syrup with very little else to balance it. Searching for more ticked off sweet fruit notes, and the finish was uninspiring.

This isn’t to say I hated the Caribbean Cask - it was just, OK. I’d be willing to give this another try in the future to see if I had a poor serving, but I certainly won’t be picking up a bottle of it myself. There are better values out there. 

3.25 ~ 77 ~ Average
Good flavor. Doesnt really taste anything like "Caribbean" but lots of flavor. Good

Right off the bat your hit with vanilla and fruit. Because it’s aged in rum casts there is a nice spice that you would associate with rum. I really like this marriage of single malt with rum, and the smoothness of this offering from Balvenie creates a really nice finish. The flavor lingers never overpowering but only compliments this drink. Although it’s price is on the higher end I truly believe it to be worth the higher price. Enjoy
caramel, kiwi, blackberries and baking spice notes
Very nice. Hint of rum flavor from the cask finish, but does not overpower the character of the scotch. Goes down smooth.

For me it's one of the best. The rum flavor is definitely here. I'm usually more fan of the iodine taste but this scotch is at the same level than some Laphroaig or others in a completely different flavor.
Nose is very minimal. Very sweet.  Spicy finish that warms the mouth. Far off the traditional single malt scotch.
Pretty solid for a scotch. Not much wood flavor, but the subtle sweetness compliments the mild heat.  Prefer the 17 year double wood in the Balvenie line.
Banana and rum on the nose. Toffee. Oaky finish.

Balvenie 14 year old Caribbean Cask may be the most reasonably priced offering from their lackluster core range.  When this is on sale, it is almost worth it.

The short rum cask finish is evident because the rum influence is only apparent in a freshly opened bottle.  After a couple of months, the dark sugars on the nose and palate fade into the nondescript honeyed notes Balvenie uses to entice the masses.  This is noticeably smoother and richer than the 12 year old, but it is ultimately a rather average Scotch that does not feel Caribbean at all.  Vanilla, honey, oranges, and a few dollars more luxurious than Monkey Shoulder.

Score: 0 (forgettable)
How much does a bottle cost: $55-75
How much do I think a bottle is worth: $50
Light on the nose. Nice balanced character. Rich and enjoyable, improved with a little water.
Initial toffee makes way for a punchy short finish. Definitely one I want to try again.
Not bad but not great. A lot like a double wood but more vanilla and dried fruit. Good over ice.
Sweet, little smoke, oily on the mouth
After experiencing more flavorful drams I am lowering this review. Its ok but not buying again.
Enjoyed this very much. Could taste the flavors I am normally not able to.
Nice malty scotch with molasses throughout and a smooth brown sugary finish. Definitely a well rounded scotch.

It's like drinking the best whisky blended with the best Rhum.

Delicious, sweet, spicy.

You want the best you got the best Balvenie
Nose is primarily oak. Flavor is honey, vanilla, and cola. Mild finish.
Very hot, but mellows nicely. Caramel and vanilla, but could stand to be iced a bit.
My favorite Balvenie.  Spice, toffee, fruity, more Spice.   Rum finish is perfectly done.
My special occasion scotch. Can’t beat the extra 2 yrs age and the rum flavoring.
Normal balvenie base with a hint of that molasses-rummy spicy sweetness. Still prefer regular balvenie
One of the best I’ve ever had

Had the 12 year DW so wanted to go side by side. Poured neat, deeper color and thicker on the glass. Nose has the same rich fruit but much more depth and smoothness is very evident. The malt and wood notes are polished and warm and it smells expensive. Palate brings a balance of delicious heavy malt with fruit, oak and spice. Just a hint of peat tops it off. The rum barrel finish delivers sweet complexity and elegance. Finish is excellent with long malty fruit, honey and wood, faint coffee and some drying but not a trace of bitterness. Overall a superb scotch with no rough edges, rich deep flavor and a great finish....93/100........I find it much better than the 12yr
It is smooth with a spicy sweetness in the middle. It smooths out again right away. I’ve liked some other Balvenies better but I like this a lot.
The rum comes through, sweet but not saccharine, clean finish

The rum is subtle but there. A semi-sweet dram that’s not to complex and easy to drink. Roasted banana, caramel, fig, some smoke and a much too quick oak finish. A unique offering and my favorite of the otherwise mundane Balvenie offerings.

Disclaimer: This was purchased in a sampler three-pack in which the bottles are exposed to light, and it's possible I received a faulty sample if stored improperly at the warehouse.

Smooth and very minorly malty and sweet, but ultimately lacking in flavor, compared to the DW12/DW17.  The slight sweetness/maltiness fades into a funk clearly from the rum cask, but not in a bad way.

Overall, this is a very non-offensive dram, but one that is completely lacking in character and flavor.
Sweet, easy to drink, but not a great *scotch*. It's like a replacement for rum.
One of my favorites. Complex for someone who usually drinks a 12 year Balvenie leaving you wanting more. I didn't expect that. This is one to share with your friends.

Color is amber. Nose starts with vanilla, wildflower honey, a little malt, and some fruity notes. First sip is subdued sweetness, with notes of fruit and spice at the same time. The spice wraps the fruit is a way that almost makes it feel warm. Mouthfeel is not thin, not oily. With additional sips, the vanilla starts to show, as do some oak notes and an incredibly subtle peat. The spice lingers, leaving a tingle on the tongue alongside the peat for the finish.

Nose: Tropical fruits hit immediately, mangoes, slight bananas and sweetness of passionfruit. Orange rind follows through with slightly charred oak. Hints of walnut, almond and slight hazelnut can be found.

Palate: The fruit holds back and gives way to strong oak and wood notes, where partial smoke appears. The fruit reappears as mango and green apples along with honey and caramel. 

Finish: Short to medium finish with heavy oak and vanilla
Light nose of wood, banana, spice, and rum. Tastes sweet, light caramel, oak, and....something nice
Nuanced Vanilla. Honey. tropical fruits. Banana. Apple. Raisins. Spice. Woody. A little strange. Complex. But not my favorite?
Tastes like a Speyside with no overly discernible rum notes. A decent dram, however not worth the price.
Tatli, dengeli. Yeni baslayanlar icin friendly

Tried neat in bar after a bourbon and should try again and get a bottle. 

Nice round flavour.

This is the Scotch that made a Scotch lover out of me. 
Nose: Sweet, a little oak and a fiant hint of rum slightly floral with a dash of honey
Taste: well bodied and smooth, not too rummy from the cask finishing, nor too sweet A great sipping dram.
Finish: medium finish with a hint of rum 
W/ a few drops of water : kicks up the nose nicely, brings out some fruit notes and notes from the rum casks. Kicks the flavor up nicely without it being too rummy, brings out a nice vanilla note on the pallet while the finish stays about the same.
Sweet sip, nice finish, a little peaty, but not bad.

Nose: Grapes. Not too strong 'alcohol burn'.

Flavour: Bit of a peppery start that goes over to a fruity taste. Definitely some sweetness.

Finish: Short to medium, pleasant.

★★★½
Avent 2019 - 22/24.
Je dois avouer que j'avais des attentes pour ce whisky. N'étant pas un amateur de whisky finis en fûts de rhum et après la déception du rye de Basil Hayden, j'avais mis beaucoup d'espoir en ce Balvenie, une distillerie qui ne fait que d'excellents produits. Je n'ai pas été charmé, mais je n'ai pas été déçu. Est-ce un pas dans la bonne direction? Est-ce que je vais devenir un grand amateur de whisky fini en fût de rhum? L'avenir nous le dira!
Me gusta mas el de 12, es mas suave
Typical elements of Speyside scotch at the front of my mouth. Rum influence kicks in in the back of my mouth. Definite vanilla notes on the nose.
Tasty. Light and flavorful. Hints of spice leather.
Sweet vanilla flavor...short but pleasant aftertaste.  Easy to drink, breath in and enjoy.
Better for sipping in the warmer months, still solid
So good. Oak-y taste. Sweet on the front end. Woodsy and slightly sweet smell.
Very light bodied scotch. Has some sweetness to it, but not much more. Was hoping for more complexity to it.

Nose: honey, vanilla, brown sugar, rum

Palate: rum, toffee, honey, vanilla, pineapple, sugar/candy, creamy

Finish: medium finish of candy sweetness

A bit too sweet and rum-like for me.
Sweet wood aroma mixed with rum. Bright and sweet sugar cane flavor, medium richness but the balance is almost perfect. Unqiue because of the rum flavor as well.
Tremendous whiskey. Light, refreshing and complex. Full of fruitiness without being sweet with a little saltiness and wood.

Dominant flavour: apple and sweetness

Nose: baked apple, sweetness and caramel 
Palate: sweetness, vanilla and clove

The Balvenie produces only unpeated whiskys (an exception is an annual special edition), unfortunately in this case chill-filtered and, alas, with added colors: a warm amber color, therefore, completely fake.
The smell is immediately sweet and caramelized, very enveloping, with cooked apple, rivers of vanilla, brown sugar (oh well, there is rum, easy!), white chocolate. It does not give you diabetes just smelling it, but it is nice and cuddly.
The risk of dismantling is also averted on the palate, with a splash of spices and wood that stops the sugary wave of flavors before it overwhelms everything, bringing a certain dryness to the background. At moments almost vinous, chocolate returns accompanied by candied orange, yellow fruit, still cane, raisins: the influence of rum is not as clear-cut as you might think (or maybe it's that I do not understand a fife of rum, in fact).
The finish is medium long, dry (almost astringent), with spices, vanilla, raisins and cooked apple.

Assez doux, pas tourbe du tout
Petite note fruitée

A sample bottle picked up in a sampler pack as I'm curious about Balvenie.

Nose: Very light with dark sugars and malty notes.  A little honey and mango on the back.

Flavor: The rum is much more of a background note on this and I appreciate it.  Sweet and light with a buttery mouth feel, crème brulee with caramelized sugars, and a little barrel char.

Finish:  Fairly short with a little bit of oaky char and finishing with a sweet mango note.

I like this a lot.  Balvenie is apparently my thing.  I appreciate the mild rum finish that didn't beat me over the head with the rum but rather accented the finished whiskey with nice dark sugar and buttery notes.  Delicious.

Rum casks aren’t usually my thing - they can veer too sweet. Here, the rum influence is very subtle and the resulting whisky as savory as much as it is sweet. America loves it - it’s on course to be Balvenie’s biggest seller in the U.S.
Deep red cherries on the nose, then cherry pull n peel Twizzlers. A bit thin on mouthfeel. Soft pleasant finish.
Nice light full flavor w sweet rum finish
Sweet, mild, some vanilla, not much depth to the flavor.
Less interesting than I hoped. Rum showed up for me mainly as sweetness. Well done but not overly exciting.
Strong taste, slight sweet but after taste, drunk straight, slight salivate after drink. Not for me

Nose: dairy, vanilla, tropical fruit of pineapple and banana, rum presence is strong

Palate: The rum is a bit overpowering - but adding a few drops of water help a lot in smoothing that out. More woody flavour, sweet fruit flavours
A little bit of rum finish.
I like this more each time. So smooth and great flavor profile.
Creamy, Fruity, and sweet with plenty of vanilla. Only missed the perfect rating with a slightly bitter finish.

Nose: Tropical fruits and creamy coffee
Palate: Vanilla, mangoes and oranges
Finish: need to try again
I'm really liking this. The bad news is that the second rum casking has IMHO taken some of the complexity out. The good news is that what's left is still an excellent dram that's a pleasure to sip.
Smooth and a bit sweet with a honey finish with a hit of vanilla that slowly tapers off

Note to self:  buy this bottle again

Sweet and fruity, lots of vanilla and hints of rum.

Nose: banana, tropical fruit, suntan lotion, cognac
Body: smooth and buttery
Palate: banana, tropical fruit, caramel, nutty, vanilla and a little grape. A very very subtle hint of smoke.
Finish: woody and rounded—lingering 

A lovely dram

Spicy aroma
Sweet, cinnamon vanilla taste
Slight astringent with warm finish
Not an impressive nose.  And not as sweet as advertised.  Smooth though
Nice blend of peat and wood in the nose. Smooth and well balanced.
So smooth. Get that nice rum sweet finish
Confusing in the best way. Smells like bourbon, initial taste of rum, back of the palette is traditional scotch
It is good. A step up on quality.
My first scotch. The rum notes came through without overwhelming the scotch. Not a bad place to start.
Nose with floral spice and toffee, some dark honey adds to the palate. Warming finish with toffee chocolate.

Rich and sweet, with lots of vanilla. Definitely more of a candy vibe compared to the 12. While I like this one, I was expecting to love it given how highly I think of the 12. Rum finish must be muting things a bit.
The vanilla notes are subtle and the spice is not overwhelming.

Nose: candy. Licorice
Palate: sweet but not rum sweet. It’s actually nice. Like a bourbon but super super light
Finish: kinda fruity
Classic Balvenie taste with a great rum finish on the palette. Love this stuff.

Nose - sweet and light, vanilla and caramel
Taste - bright with more vanilla and a hint of rum dryness comes though
Finish - light and thin but refreshing
I don’t think of myself as a scotch person, more of a bourbon guy. But this is accessible and I liked it.

Nose was hard to get since I had it at a restaurant and they didn’t use a snifter. 
Nose- nutty and light vanilla. Was pretty tipsy at this point so not smelling much else, slight banana

Taste- nutty and earthy and woody, sweet spicy finish
This is in my top 5. Sweet, spicy, fruity, and so incredibly smooth. I keep coming back to this when I'm looking for a premium Scotch. (Usually that means business trip)
Sweat with fruits flavor, such as pineapples or peaches
Great, enjoyable scotch. Very smooth and subtle flavor. Subtle rum finish.
Sultanas, vanilla, oats and condensed milk on the nose. A fruity white pepper and spice arrival. A sweet finish of molasses and green grass.

Very rich and pleasant but a light finish. 

Nose: typical Balvenie, extra vanilla, brown sugar (very bourbon like) and some
bready notes

Taste: bright and zesty

Finish: short to medium 

17-year double wood is my favorite but this one is a bit better than your standard Balvenie 12
Light golden hue leads into this sweet scotch with honey overtones. The rum cask is lightly present, but present nonetheless. Personally, I prefer the Balvenie sans rum cask finish.
Hints of honey and vanilla! A little dry on the tongue with a slight bite to finish.
Soft vanilla tones. Great hints of rum.
One of my favorite scotches for sure. Not many scotches have distinct sweetness but this one does and it’s a nice change up.

Nose: sweetish orange, vanilla, slight wood and leather
Taste: silky, balanced mild sweetness, hints of liquorice, wood, peppery.
Finish: warm, smooth, not specific
A pleasant fruity aroma. Nice on the palate, but something in the aftertaste that sits wrong.  This taste from trial size. No cork. Maybe let sit too long before opening.

Vanilla, honey, and a lemony sour note from the oak on the nose.  The palate is vanilla and a slight fruitiness, then cane sugar.  The combination of rum and oak produces a surprising cinnamon and tobacco note (if you can find it in the spice notes that are unique to this bottle).  Follow that note and the oak makes itself known in the finish.  The cinnamon with the oak reminds me of a bourbon mid-palate-to-finish, albeit with an infusion of rum sweetness.  Different and interesting to drink, but not a personal fave.  It may fare better with a cigar.  

I don't know why I didn't like this whisky, despite the glowing reviews.  I was extremely disappointed in my palate for missing whatever that was good.  I just couldn't lock on the Balvenie flavor profile.

While rum was the currency that introduced the world to the English concept of "proof", it hasn't exactly done wonders here.



My Rating Glossary:  

Two Stars:           "I'd rather be drinking lite beer."
Two 1/2 Stars:    "Posh rubbish."
Three Stars:        "I love whisk(e)y.  This is average love."
Three 1/2 Stars: "May buy again."
Four Stars:          "I've got to get you into my life."
Four 1/2 Stars:   "Better than drugs."
Five Stars:           "Life is good.  Whisky makes it better."

Nose - grapes, vanilla, sugar
Palate - not getting much of the rum influence, I prefer their 12 year
Finish - rum finally shows up in the finish with a touch of molasses and burnt sugar

A co-worker recommended this scotch to me, as I like to drink rum.  The nose is fruity, I get like bubblegum, and the palate is sweet honey, but I’m not getting much of the rum influence.   Maybe the sweetness.  The finish is warm and medium.  A great dram.
Very very smooth, strong hazelnuts, cane sweetness on a distant background. Short moment of honey in the finish.

Finally got a bottle of Fire & Cane.  Wanted to compare two rum finished whiskies, so I compared the Balvenie 14 Caribbean Cask with the Fire & Cane, interesting match.
 - On the nose, the Caribbean Cask (CC) was sweeter and mellow.  The Fire & Cane (F&C) was strong, with a slight smokey influence in the background with fruits like orange... something citric.
 - On the palate, the CC was sweet... honey, sugary; the F&C was smoke with pears and a little sweetness, but nothing like the CC.
 - On the finish the CC was smooth and light; the F&C was strong, medium last, but it makes you remember that you are drinking a scotch whisky.

Overall I liked them both.  I will drink the CC maybe after dinner, but if I want to relax while watching an action movie, then the F&C will be the choice.

Classic Scotch aromas and nose, fruity, with that twang of smoke. Incredibly vanilla smoothness at first taste that really stick around. I get a nice oak here and there too - which really lends itself to the Scotch X Rum vibe they were going for. Great taste, very smooth finish.
Sweeter, lighter, and fruitier than I usually like my scotch, but this one balances it all so well
Too much rum for me and weak finish
Nice spicy rum flavor and gets spicier the more you drink it, nice sweet notes as well

After i had 5 balvenies i finally got my veredict on the distillery and that is a THUMBS DOWN. It just feels that any other expression older than 12yo is plain water. The 25yo was a complete dissapointment and this one follows that path. 

Bottled at 43%abv.

On the nose it was great. I have to be honest. Super fruity, tropical fruits. Oranges, prunes, cherry, cranberries, coffee beans. It was simply beaitiful.

But then.... water.

On the palate is just plain water. Ok lets be fair. There is a hint of vanilla. A hint of oak and some spiciness but it doesn't give you anything. It is not a rewarding dram. It is water. 

Aftertaste is short and dry. Hints of oak spice. Nothing else.

Overall i give this dram a 68 over 100 and that is because the nose was great. Then it fell apart drastically. Not recommended.
immense warmth, hint of black licorice and, I'm reliably informed, English toffee with a dry finish

Great scotch made better by aging in rum barrels. Nose is sugar cane and sweetness. Palate taste the brightness of good clean scotch with a candied dried plum and just a hint of black licorice. Finish the rum shows for a short while.

Score-3.5

Scale
1-choke it down or pour it down the sink
2-drinkable but would not buy again 
3-solid would buy again 
4-seek it want it need it in my cabinet
5- life changing might name a kid after it

Often when a whisky is finished in rum casks, it overpowers the whisky and becomes an odd mongrel that doesn’t complement either spirits.

This whisky is well balanced whisky.  It has a lovely creamy vanilla taste upfront, but there’s plenty of fruit with apples and oranges and topped off with subtle molasses.  The finish is long, with a lot of citrus and vanilla.

Overall, a lovely well-rounded, sweet vanilla dram.
Erg kruidige, rummy neus. Banaan? Zeer zacht, rond. Subtiel doch krachtig.
Süß, Zuckerrohr sowohl im Geruch als auch im Geschmack, etwas Pfeffer auf der Zunge

Color: Honey. Moderate almost watery legs

Nose: Vanilla rum, oak, sugary apple juice, melon, tobacco

Palate: Vanilla rum, oak, apple juice, almost silky texture

Finish: Moderate with charcoal, cinnamon, green tea, tobacco notes. It's rounded out with barrel tannin and a lingering minor spice note that engulfs the tongue.

I've had a pour of this before but, I don't remember it being as good. It comes off as very rum forward on the nose and palate at first. Letting it develop, opens this dram up. It's almost chaotic but, beautifully balanced at the same time. Nose and palate are very similar. Though, on the nose I'm also picking up unripe melon and a sweet tobacco note influenced by the vanilla rum. The finish is where it's at for me. Tobacco from the nose comes back along with an amazing green tea note. Although I don't want to give this a 3.75 because of my previous experience. I have to. Credit where credit is due.
It's pretty amazing but not super interesting

Rum casks have always intrigued me, but always seem to let me down. I thought Balvenie might be able to change that, unfortunately I was wrong. Is it drinkable? Yes, but the sickly sweet rum flavor tastes artificial and left me disappointed once more.
This is one of the smoothest & easy to drink whiskey’s I’ve had. It’s a bit on the sweet side but I like that.

Nose : sweet, apricot, raisins, hint of chocolate
Taste : sweet, oily, mild spices
Finish : balanced sweetness, some laurel
Sweet hints of Oak with one of the smoothest finishes of Vanilla I’ve had. Always drink it neat with 2-3 drop of water to open it up.

This is good. It's like the meringue of Glenmorangie 18 meets the rummy spiciness of Compass Box Spice Tree. Despite the fun rum presence here, this seems more like a quirky Scotch since there is not a lot going on. the sweetness and richness are nice, but I wish that the alcohol were less present.
It has a rich, woody scent with some rich dark fruity notes that blend in nicely. There's a bit of spice on the nose too and some interesting tartness. The nose smells delightful, if not super complex. The palate is more viscous than that of the 17, but also less rich. It has some really nice sweetness with spices and rich butterscotch. I wouldn't have thought that coming back to this I might be crowning it king of the Balvenie line, but here I am considering just that. I like it pretty well, though it is light and on the more hedonistically sweet side. There's some really nice balance of wood with baking spices and butterscotch though. The mouthfeel is really nice too. It takes the hedonistic route and succeeds. What more does it need to do? For the price, it's a questionable purchase. It reminds me a bit of Glenfiddich 14, but with a bit more sweetness and refinement perhaps. It tastes good. There's some banana, but it's light and has a bit of caramel on it. The vanilla and tropical fruits are really nicely balanced here. I'd like to try a richer, older version of this, but it hits a really nice bourbony scotch flavor profile that is classic in nature and also rich and enjoyable. It's quite a good drink. The balance here is really impressive and it's quite enjoyable to drink. A 16 is achieved easily and a 17 is definitely believable.
Wonderfully smooth scotch with hints of a spiced rum
spicy and salty; hint of sweet tropical fruit
Pretty strong cherry and almond nose; brown sugar, vanilla, and chocolate; smooth, unctuous; dry caramel and brown sugar finish; really nice for its subtle, but complex and dark flavors the rum lends

Copper color. Fruit-forward nose with red grapes and stewed plums, hints of burnt sugar, vanilla bean and cocoa powder. Light bodied mouthfeel. Flavors are subtle and hard to pick out but I'm getting more stewed fruits, candied apples and chocolate covered pretzels. Finish is pretty short and unimpressive, maybe some grapes and sweet red cherries, and a little peppercorn spice.
Courtesy of AT - Sweet, spicy, rich vanilla and distinct rum flavors coming through in this solid Speyside tasting.
Very nice. Easy to drink and full of flavour.
Good, but not as good as the 12 year double wood. Similar but sweeter on the finish.
